intro: Calophanes ovatus, commonly known as the oval-leaf calophanes, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae, which includes many ornamental and horticulturally important plants. The plant is characterized by its ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
